urls.title: Welcome to Floodsaxdirect¬Æ | Floodsax¬Æ - the innovative, convenient, easy-to-use alternative to sandbags for flood and spill management
urls.description: Floodsax¬Æ are the innovative, convenient, easy-to-use alternative to sandbags for flood and spill management. Floodsax stop water in its tracks. The semi-porous inner liner contains hundreds of absorbent crystals which absorb water to 90% capacity in just 3 minutes. Once the water is in there, it stays there and the bags act just like sandbags to keep floods at bay. They are designed so they mould into doorways to keep floodwater out.

urls.title: Guest blog - 100 acres of Bog, Heath and Grassland destroyed by tree-planting, by Miles King - Mark Avery
urls.description: Miles King has written regularly on this site. His previous blogs and more information about him can be found here. Twitter: @MilesKing10 Berrier Farm under Trees: 100 acres of Bog, Heath and Grassland destroyed by tree-planting. England desperately needs more trees, we are constantly told. And it‚Äôs certainly true that tree cover here is lower than most other European countries. The data must be handled with care though, when tree cover can include anything from Eucalyptus plantations in Spain, to Sitka

text:
RT @MarkAvery: Guest blog by @MilesKing10 : 100 acres of Bog, Heath and Grassland destroyed by tree-planting https://t.co/S8VE3F679X

@Fore‚Ä¶

They are a waste of campaign energy. The others here  however are all genuine and do as little as parodies

urls.description: Miles King has written regularly on this site. His previous blogs and more information about him can be found here. Twitter: @MilesKing10 Berrier Farm under Trees: 100 acres of Bog, Heath and Grassland destroyed by tree-planting. England desperately needs more trees, we are constantly told. And it‚Äôs certainly true that tree cover here is lower than most other European countries. The data must be handled with care though, when tree cover can include anything from Eucalyptus plantations in Spain, to Sitka

text:
RT @MarkAvery: Guest blog by @MilesKing10 : 100 acres of Bog, Heath and Grassland destroyed by tree-planting https://t.co/S8VE3F679X

@Fore‚Ä¶

@ForestryEngland @MilesKing10 @MarkAvery @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @lakedistrictnpa @IUCNpeat @DefraGovUK @cumbriawildlife @NECumbria @Love_plants @pow_rebecca @VictoriaPrentis I think that's clear, but I'd appreciate it if you'd explain why you won't reverse your decision?

urls.description: Miles King has written regularly on this site. His previous blogs and more information about him can be found here. text:
RT @MarkAvery: Guest blog by @MilesKing10 : 100 acres of Bog, Heath and Grassland destroyed by tree-planting https://t.co/S8VE3F679X

@Fore‚Ä¶

@FinlayMcCulloch @MarkAvery @MilesKing10 @ForestryEngland @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @lakedistrictnpa @IUCNpeat @DefraGovUK @cumbriawildlife @NECumbria @Love_plants @pow_rebecca @VictoriaPrentis It isn't best practice and makes no sense silviculturally, makes very unstable trees but it is very cheap though. Establishment  is down to the landowner or more likely their agent trying for maximum grants, minimum outlay.  Looks like someone knows how to play the system to me.

text: Joint patrols with @EnvAgencyAnglia yesterday at Heachem North Beach looking at illegal fishing. Please to report no issues we also made a visit to another location around protected species after intelligence had been received. #partnershipworking #1765 https://t.co/cSviZxWEvy
@ShefEnvironment @EnvAgencyYNE @plumeplotter @AireIncinerator

This really needs to change. Timing, frequency, really necessary? @EnvAgency @greatyarmouthbc @BroadsNP 
#biodiversitycrisis #ActOnClimate https://t.co/qBXdMqfGEr

@GeorgeEustice_ @MissLed20 @GeorgeMonbiot @EnvAgency @JamesBevanEA @pow_rebecca @ZacGoldsmith @nadams @Feargal_Sharkey @EMorfett And what are you doing to help current problems other than voting against feeding poor children & against protecting British food and agriculture standards? It would be great to know. What a puerile response, from an environment minister too... #extinctionisforever
